intro: Scariola amorgina, commonly known as the Amorgos bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Greek island of Amorgos. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Scariola amorgina is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive blooms. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native habitat.
